sub_title: Industrial Design Engineer | Researcher | Design & Innovation Strategist | Architect
summary:
Hello! 
I am an Industrial Design Engineer, Researcher, Design and Innovation Strategist, and an Architect. I recently graduated from TU Delft  (Delft University of Technology, Europe), by working on a collaborative graduation thesis project between Stanford University School of Mechanical Engineering (San Francisco, USA) and TU Delft Faculty of Industrial Design Engineering. Through my M.S. thesis titled ‘Talking with your car’: A Design Exploration of Human-Centered Conversational AI in Autonomous Vehicles, I specialized in Design Innovation Strategy, Generative AI (Conversational AI),  Autonomous Vehicles, and User Experience / User Interface design research. 

In my recent work experiences, I have applied my skills and knowledge to various domains and sectors, such as automotive, robotics, aviation, social enterprise, and architecture. I have worked on professional technology design research projects for Mercedes-Benz and Boeing, contributed to the innovation strategy for the Royal Schiphol Group, and supported the operations management department of AeroDelft (a student-led dream team initiative to build the world's first liquid hydrogen-powered aircraft). I am passionate about finding innovative solutions for complex and meaningful challenges, and I value collaboration, learning, and impact. I believe that I can bring diverse perspectives and experiences to the team, and help create positive change in the world. 

Feel free to get in touch to discuss interesting projects or for a chat over coffee.

profile_positions.description:
YES!Delft Startup accelerator's Impact Lab Spot team works with the Boston Dynamics' agile mobile robot named Spot, that navigates terrain with unprecedented mobility, allowing it to automate routine inspection tasks and data capture safely, accurately, and frequently. The Impact Lab team explores technical applications and works with multiple stakeholders in finding new applications by working hands-on with Spot.

My contribution to the team is from the perspective of innovation management + strategy, research in Human-robot interaction and design engineering.
profile_positions.title: Researcher & Innovation Manager

profile_positions.description: Worked on a professional technology design research project for Mercedes-Benz as an academic collaboration with TU Delft | Industrial Design Engineering.
profile_positions.title: Technology Design Researcher (Student)

profile_positions.description:
In order to develop an innovation strategy for the Royal Schiphol Group, the following process was followed: 

RESEARCH
As the task given to us was very open ended with many possible directions to take, we decided to approach the assignment by first undertaking desktop research through reading scientific papers and journals.

STAKEHOLDER INTERVIEWS
Based on our desktop research, we determined which organizations would be our key stakeholders. We interviewed eminent people representing these organizations and recorded as well as transcribed their interviews which served as data for further analysis.

DATA ANALYSIS
We began analyzing the data by selecting important quotes first and then deriving core concepts from it. Once we had the core concepts, we categorized them into themes.

THEME CLUSTERING
We clustered our themes in 4 quadrants of Desirability, Feasibility, Viability and Responsibility after debating within the team. This helped us understand the data better and informed our understanding on the way ahead.

DEVELOPING STRATEGY STATEMENT
Based on themes derived and clustered, we decided to develop a strategy statement to guide us through the next phase.

REORIENTATION
Once we had an advisory discussion with the entire innovation hub, we re-oriented ourselves to follow a new approach to project. Rather than suggesting the modalities to choose in the future, we focused our process on developing a set of criteria that could be used to choose modalities developed in the future.

FORMULATION OF CRITERIA
We started to formulate a set of criteria based on data analyzed. The set of criteria was categorized into Desirability, Feasibility, Viability and Responsibility to be more effective in decision making.

TESTING AND FINALISATION
After testing the criteria by applying to real cases, we determined the best way to deliver the criteria set is through an excel sheet. We developed a scoring system wherein modalities could be scored and weighed against each other.
profile_positions.title: Innovator

profile_positions.description: The group conducts active research in human-centered design, art, computer science and the intersection of all the aforementioned fields, enabling design students of the faculty to explore the topic of AI from a direction of experimentation and tinkering, as well as organizing inspiring meetups and talks that explore interesting notions on technology, art and design.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant | Project Google AI in Artificial Intelligence & Experience Design research group

profile_positions.description:
AeroDelft is a TU Delft student team based out of the Faculty of Aerospace Engineering with one mission: prove that emission-free aviation is possible by developing the world’s first liquid hydrogen-powered aircraft. 



AeroDelft's is currently working to prove and promote liquid hydrogen as an alternative to conventional aviation fuel, to inspire the aviation industry to make the change on a scale that will result in worldwide sustainable aviation.

Had the opportunity to work on the design of livery of aeroplanes, design of merchandise and design of graphics for publishing of AeroDelft's communication material.
profile_positions.title: Events + Graphic Design Manager, Operations Management Department.

profile_positions.description: Project X was an interdisciplinary collaborative project organized by Boeing, NATO, TU Delft and Unmanned Valley on designing drone systems for undertaking operations in hazardous areas. I was part of an interdisciplinary team as a Design Engineer along with Embedded Systems engineering, Industrial Design Engineering and Aerospace Engineering students. We developed a solution with multiple drones to detect hazardous leaks in urban regions that could assess the degree of destruction caused and send the data back to the central command. The central command can then choose to take suitable action based on the data received from the drone system. This project was a step towards developing intelligent autonomous systems that could aid relevant authorities during crisis situations in inaccessible locations.

profile_positions.description:
Co-founded Funbrio Games with 3 other members, with the objective of popularizing healthy, educative and joyful gaming culture in the world.

Developed the business plan, innovative gaming products & website experience. Gained engagement from 50 nations & 500+ followers on Instagram.

Our clients included Luma World, Cacahuete Games, Dice Toy Labs, Non Serious Games, Portal Dragons and others.

Do find more information on projects accomplished on the official website of the firm: 

https://www.funbriogames.com/

profile_positions.description:
Co-founded Neevriti Studio, an interdisciplinary design firm, with the objective of providing a comprehensive design solution to clients.

Generated revenue of 3 Lakhs till present through our work. Led & developed architectural, interior and product designs.

Clients until now include MP State Government of India & private organisations. Won International Award in Covid-19 Innovation Grant Competition.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder & Architectural Designer.

profile_positions.description:
UCJ - Architecture & Environment is a renowned architecture and urbanism firm founded by the Indian Master Architect Uttam C. Jain in 1961. The firm is currently headed jointly by Ar. Chirag Jain & Ar. Shona Jain, steering the firm to new heights of achievements by undertaking eminent projects all over India.
 
As a project architect, I undertook architectural design, product design, urban design, interior design, 3D visualization, CAD developing construction drawings, creative renderings, preparation of documents for government bodies and site supervision. I was involved individually and collectively in the design and construction of following projects: 

1) Manohar Parrikar Smriti Sthal, Government of Goa, India.
2) Sanquelim bus terminal & mini depot, Government of Goa, India
3) Headquarters of directorate of accounts, Government of Goa, India.
4) Bicholim bus terminus, Government of Goa, India.
5) Margao wholesale fish market, Government of Goa, India.
6) Ravindra bhavan cultural centre, Government of Goa, India. 
7) Neelam mixed used development, Rajasthan, India.
8) Panthawada high school redevelopment project, Gujarat, India. 

Do find more information and visualisations of the above projects on the official website of the firm: 

https://www.ucj.co.in/
